intro: Arctotis leiocarpa, commonly known as the white sand everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, bright yellow flowers with a white center, which bloom throughout the growing season. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ability to retain its color and form when dried makes it a valued plant for floral arrangements.
